availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mary B. Trimble. Father of Eliza G. Trimble, Fanny Trimble, Lawrence Tremble, Hellen Trimble, and William Trimble. Kate Trimble. Attorney in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Attorney in Harrison County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 92A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 369.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 121B.
